alert.note: Alert for Carroll (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 24 at 3:53AM EST until December 24 at 3:30PM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM EST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of Maine, including the following counties, Androscoggin, Cumberland, Franklin, Kennebec, Oxford, Somerset and Waldo. Portions of northern New Hampshire, including the following counties, Carroll and Coos. * WHEN...Until 1000 AM EST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 350 AM EST, Despite the fact the the rain has ended, several smaller rivers and streams are still rising, and may cause additional flooding this morning. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Auburn, Waterville, Farmington, Fairfield, Bridgton, Fryeburg, Mechanic Falls, Bethel, Turner, and Rumford.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
